messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
Properties:
  Power Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Fan Speed
    Enum
      Low [1]
      Medium [2]
      High [3]
  Filter Life Remaining
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
Accepted Commands:
  PowerOn [PON]
  PowerOff [POF]
  SetFanSpeed [SFS]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ResetFilter [RF]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFilterLife [RFL]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the user's request. The device accepts PowerOn [PON] to turn the device on and SetFanSpeed [SFS] with a parameter to set the fan speed. The fan speed parameter accepts Low [1], Medium [2], and High [3].

To turn on the air purifier, I will use the PowerOn command. Then, to set the fan speed to high, I will use SetFanSpeed with the parameter High [3].

Result: Execute PowerOn [PON] to turn on the device, then SetFanSpeed [SFS] with parameter High [3] to set the fan speed to high.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
Properties:
  Power Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Fan Speed
    Enum
      Low [1]
      Medium [2]
      High [3]
  Filter Life Remaining
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
Accepted Commands:
  PowerOn [PON]
  PowerOff [POF]
  SetFanSpeed [SFS]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ResetFilter [RF]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFilterLife [RFL]

USER QUERY:
What is the current filter life remaining on the air purifier?

The device has a property called Filter Life Remaining, which is an integer ranging from 0 to 100 percent. To get this information, the device supports the ReportFilterLife [RFL] send command.

Therefore, to find out the current filter life remaining, I will use the ReportFilterLife command to query the device.

Result: Send ReportFilterLife [RFL] command to retrieve the current filter life remaining percentage.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
Properties:
  Power Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Fan Speed
    Enum
      Low [1]
      Medium [2]
      High [3]
  Filter Life Remaining
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
Accepted Commands:
  PowerOn [PON]
  PowerOff [POF]
  SetFanSpeed [SFS]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ResetFilter [RF]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFilterLife [RFL]

USER QUERY:
Please turn off the air purifier and reset the filter life counter.

The user wants to turn off the air purifier and reset the filter life counter. The device accepts PowerOff [POF] to turn off the device and ResetFilter [RF] to reset the filter life.

Step 1: Use PowerOff [POF] to switch the device off.
Step 2: Use ResetFilter [RF] to reset the filter life counter.

Result: Execute PowerOff [POF] to turn off the air purifier, then ResetFilter [RF] to reset the filter life counter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Thermostat
Properties:
  Current Temperature
    Float
    Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
  Target Temperature
    Float
    Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
  Mode
    Enum
      Off [0]
      Heat [1]
      Cool [2]
      Auto [3]
Accepted Commands:
  SetTargetTemperature [STT]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
  SetMode [SM]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
Send Commands:
  ReportCurrentTemperature [RCT]
  ReportMode [RM]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and switch it to auto mode.

The device has a Target Temperature property with a range from 10.0 to 30.0 °C and a Mode property with enum values Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto. The accepted commands to change these are SetTargetTemperature and SetMode.

Step 1: Use SetTargetTemperature with parameter 22.0 °C to set the desired temperature.
Step 2: Use SetMode with parameter Auto [3] to switch the thermostat to auto mode.

Result: Execute SetTargetTemperature(22.0) and SetMode(Auto) to set the thermostat to 22 °C and auto mode.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Thermostat
Properties:
  Current Temperature
    Float
    Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
  Target Temperature
    Float
    Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
  Mode
    Enum
      Off [0]
      Heat [1]
      Cool [2]
      Auto [3]
Accepted Commands:
  SetTargetTemperature [STT]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
  SetMode [SM]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
Send Commands:
  ReportCurrentTemperature [RCT]
  ReportMode [RM]

USER QUERY:
What's the current temperature reading from the thermostat?

The device has a property called Current Temperature, which is a float value between 5.0 and 35.0 °C. To get this value, the device supports the ReportCurrentTemperature [RCT] send command.

Therefore, to find out the current temperature, I will send the ReportCurrentTemperature command to the device.

Result: Send ReportCurrentTemperature [RCT] command to retrieve the current temperature reading.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Thermostat
Properties:
  Current Temperature
    Float
    Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
  Target Temperature
    Float
    Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
  Mode
    Enum
      Off [0]
      Heat [1]
      Cool [2]
      Auto [3]
Accepted Commands:
  SetTargetTemperature [STT]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
  SetMode [SM]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
Send Commands:
  ReportCurrentTemperature [RCT]
  ReportMode [RM]

USER QUERY:
Can you switch the thermostat off?

The thermostat's Mode property includes an Off state with enum value [0]. To switch the thermostat off, the accepted command is SetMode with parameter Off [0].

Step 1: Use SetMode command with parameter Off [0] to turn off the thermostat.

Result: Execute SetMode(Off) to switch the thermostat off.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Light Bulb
Properties:
  Brightness
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  Color
    Enum
      Red [1]
      Green [2]
      Blue [3]
      White [4]
      Warm White [5]
  Power State
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
Accepted Commands:
  SetBrightness [SB]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  SetColor [SC]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Red [1]
        Green [2]
        Blue [3]
        White [4]
        Warm White [5]
  TurnOn [TON]
  TurnOff [TOF]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]

USER QUERY:
Please set the living room light to 75% brightness and change the color to warm white.

The device supports setting brightness with SetBrightness [SB] command accepting a parameter from 0 to 100 percent, and setting color with SetColor [SC] command accepting enumerated values including Warm White [5].

Step 1: Use SetBrightness with parameter 75 to set brightness to 75%.
Step 2: Use SetColor with parameter Warm White [5] to change the color.

Result: Execute SetBrightness(75) and SetColor(Warm White) to set the living room light to 75% brightness and warm white color.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Light Bulb
Properties:
  Brightness
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  Color
    Enum
      Red [1]
      Green [2]
      Blue [3]
      White [4]
      Warm White [5]
  Power State
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
Accepted Commands:
  SetBrightness [SB]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  SetColor [SC]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Red [1]
        Green [2]
        Blue [3]
        White [4]
        Warm White [5]
  TurnOn [TON]
  TurnOff [TOF]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]

USER QUERY:
Is the bedroom light currently on or off?

The device has a Power State property with enum values Off [0] and On [1]. To determine the current power state, the device supports the ReportStatus [RS] send command.

Step 1: Send ReportStatus command to retrieve the current power state.
Step 2: Interpret the returned Power State property to determine if the light is on or off.

Result: Send ReportStatus [RS] to check if the bedroom light is currently on or off.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Light Bulb
Properties:
  Brightness
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  Color
    Enum
      Red [1]
      Green [2]
      Blue [3]
      White [4]
      Warm White [5]
  Power State
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
Accepted Commands:
  SetBrightness [SB]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  SetColor [SC]
    Parameter 1: []
      Enum
        Red [1]
        Green [2]
        Blue [3]
        White [4]
        Warm White [5]
  TurnOn [TON]
  TurnOff [TOF]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]

USER QUERY:
Turn off the kitchen light and set brightness to 0%.

The user wants to turn off the kitchen light and set its brightness to 0%. The device accepts TurnOff [TOF] to switch off the light and SetBrightness [SB] with a parameter from 0 to 100 percent.

Step 1: Use TurnOff [TOF] command to turn off the light.
Step 2: Use SetBrightness [SB] with parameter 0 to set brightness to 0%.

Result: Execute TurnOff [TOF] and SetBrightness(0) to turn off the kitchen light and set brightness to 0%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Energy Meter
Properties:
  Current Power Usage
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
  Total Energy Consumed
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 10000.0 Unit kWh
  Status
    Enum
      Normal [0]
      Warning [1]
      Error [2]
Accepted Commands:
  ResetEnergyCounter [REC]
  SetWarningThreshold [SWT]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 100.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
Send Commands:
  ReportCurrentPower [RCP]
  ReportTotalEnergy [RTE]
  ReportStatus [RS]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and total energy consumed according to the energy meter?

The device has two relevant properties: Current Power Usage (0.0 to 5000.0 W) and Total Energy Consumed (0.0 to 10000.0 kWh). To retrieve these, the device supports ReportCurrentPower [RCP] and ReportTotalEnergy [RTE] send commands.

Step 1: Send ReportCurrentPower to get the current power usage in watts.
Step 2: Send ReportTotalEnergy to get the total energy consumed in kilowatt-hours.

Result: Send ReportCurrentPower [RCP] and ReportTotalEnergy [RTE] commands to obtain current power usage and total energy consumed.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Energy Meter
Properties:
  Current Power Usage
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
  Total Energy Consumed
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 10000.0 Unit kWh
  Status
    Enum
      Normal [0]
      Warning [1]
      Error [2]
Accepted Commands:
  ResetEnergyCounter [REC]
  SetWarningThreshold [SWT]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 100.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
Send Commands:
  ReportCurrentPower [RCP]
  ReportTotalEnergy [RTE]
  ReportStatus [RS]

USER QUERY:
Please set the warning threshold to 3000 watts and reset the energy counter.

The device accepts SetWarningThreshold [SWT] command with a parameter ranging from 100.0 to 5000.0 watts, and ResetEnergyCounter [REC] to reset the energy counter.

Step 1: Use SetWarningThreshold with parameter 3000.0 W to set the warning threshold.
Step 2: Use ResetEnergyCounter to reset the total energy consumed counter.

Result: Execute SetWarningThreshold(3000.0) and ResetEnergyCounter [REC] to set the warning threshold and reset the energy counter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Energy Meter
Properties:
  Current Power Usage
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
  Total Energy Consumed
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 10000.0 Unit kWh
  Status
    Enum
      Normal [0]
      Warning [1]
      Error [2]
Accepted Commands:
  ResetEnergyCounter [REC]
  SetWarningThreshold [SWT]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 100.0 to 5000.0 Unit W
Send Commands:
  ReportCurrentPower [RCP]
  ReportTotalEnergy [RTE]
  ReportStatus [RS]

USER QUERY:
Is the energy meter reporting any errors or warnings right now?

The device has a Status property with enum values Normal [0], Warning [1], and Error [2]. To check the current status, the device supports the ReportStatus [RS] send command.

Step 1: Send ReportStatus command to retrieve the current status.
Step 2: Interpret the returned Status property to determine if there are any warnings or errors.

Result: Send ReportStatus [RS] to check if the energy meter is reporting any errors or warnings.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Door Lock
Properties:
  Lock State
    Enum
      Locked [1]
      Unlocked [0]
  Battery Level
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
Accepted Commands:
  LockDoor [LD]
  UnlockDoor [UD]
  QueryBattery [QB]
Send Commands:
  ReportLockState [RLS]
  ReportBatteryLevel [RBL]

USER QUERY:
Can you unlock the front door and tell me the battery level?

The device accepts UnlockDoor [UD] to unlock the door and QueryBattery [QB] to query battery status. Additionally, it supports ReportBatteryLevel [RBL] to report battery level.

Step 1: Use UnlockDoor [UD] command to unlock the door.
Step 2: Use ReportBatteryLevel [RBL] to get the current battery level percentage.

Result: Execute UnlockDoor [UD] to unlock the front door, then send ReportBatteryLevel [RBL] to retrieve the battery level.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Door Lock
Properties:
  Lock State
    Enum
      Locked [1]
      Unlocked [0]
  Battery Level
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
Accepted Commands:
  LockDoor [LD]
  UnlockDoor [UD]
  QueryBattery [QB]
Send Commands:
  ReportLockState [RLS]
  ReportBatteryLevel [RBL]

USER QUERY:
Is the door currently locked?

The device has a Lock State property with enum values Locked [1] and Unlocked [0]. To determine the current lock state, the device supports ReportLockState [RLS] send command.

Step 1: Send ReportLockState command to retrieve the current lock state.
Step 2: Interpret the returned Lock State property to determine if the door is locked or unlocked.

Result: Send ReportLockState [RLS] to check if the door is currently locked.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Door Lock
Properties:
  Lock State
    Enum
      Locked [1]
      Unlocked [0]
  Battery Level
    Integer
    Range 0 to 100 Unit %
Accepted Commands:
  LockDoor [LD]
  UnlockDoor [UD]
  QueryBattery [QB]
Send Commands:
  ReportLockState [RLS]
  ReportBatteryLevel [RBL]

USER QUERY:
Please lock the door now.

The device accepts LockDoor [LD] command to lock the door.

Step 1: Use LockDoor [LD] command to lock the door immediately.

Result: Execute LockDoor [LD] to lock the door now.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Sprinkler System
Properties:
  Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Water Flow Rate
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  Schedule Enabled
    Enum
      False [0]
      True [1]
Accepted Commands:
  TurnOnSprinkler [TOS]
  TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS]
  SetFlowRate [SFR]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  EnableSchedule [ES]
  DisableSchedule [DS]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFlowRate [RFR]
  ReportScheduleStatus [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Can you enable the sprinkler schedule and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute?

The device accepts EnableSchedule [ES] to enable the schedule and SetFlowRate [SFR] with a parameter from 0.0 to 20.0 L/min to set the water flow rate.

Step 1: Use EnableSchedule [ES] to enable the sprinkler schedule.
Step 2: Use SetFlowRate [SFR] with parameter 15.0 L/min to set the flow rate.

Result: Execute EnableSchedule [ES] and SetFlowRate(15.0) to enable the schedule and set water flow rate to 15 L/min.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Sprinkler System
Properties:
  Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Water Flow Rate
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  Schedule Enabled
    Enum
      False [0]
      True [1]
Accepted Commands:
  TurnOnSprinkler [TOS]
  TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS]
  SetFlowRate [SFR]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  EnableSchedule [ES]
  DisableSchedule [DS]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFlowRate [RFR]
  ReportScheduleStatus [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Is the sprinkler currently on and what is the flow rate?

The device has a Status property with enum Off [0] and On [1], and a Water Flow Rate property ranging from 0.0 to 20.0 L/min. To get these values, the device supports ReportStatus [RS] and ReportFlowRate [RFR] send commands.

Step 1: Send ReportStatus to check if the sprinkler is on or off.
Step 2: Send ReportFlowRate to get the current water flow rate in liters per minute.

Result: Send ReportStatus [RS] and ReportFlowRate [RFR] to determine if the sprinkler is on and its flow rate.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Sprinkler System
Properties:
  Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Water Flow Rate
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  Schedule Enabled
    Enum
      False [0]
      True [1]
Accepted Commands:
  TurnOnSprinkler [TOS]
  TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS]
  SetFlowRate [SFR]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  EnableSchedule [ES]
  DisableSchedule [DS]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFlowRate [RFR]
  ReportScheduleStatus [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn off the sprinkler and disable the schedule.

The device accepts TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS] to turn off the sprinkler and DisableSchedule [DS] to disable the schedule.

Step 1: Use TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS] to switch off the sprinkler.
Step 2: Use DisableSchedule [DS] to disable the watering schedule.

Result: Execute TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS] and DisableSchedule [DS] to turn off the sprinkler and disable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
Device: NuCore Smart Sprinkler System
Properties:
  Status
    Enum
      Off [0]
      On [1]
  Water Flow Rate
    Float
    Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  Schedule Enabled
    Enum
      False [0]
      True [1]
Accepted Commands:
  TurnOnSprinkler [TOS]
  TurnOffSprinkler [TOFS]
  SetFlowRate [SFR]
    Parameter 1: []
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
  EnableSchedule [ES]
  DisableSchedule [DS]
Send Commands:
  ReportStatus [RS]
  ReportFlowRate [RFR]
  ReportScheduleStatus [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Is the sprinkler schedule enabled right now?

The device has a Schedule Enabled property with enum False [0] and True [1]. To check this, the device supports ReportScheduleStatus [RSS] send command.

Step 1: Send ReportScheduleStatus to retrieve the current schedule enabled status.
Step 2: Interpret the returned value to determine if the schedule is enabled or disabled.

Result: Send ReportScheduleStatus [RSS] to check if the sprinkler schedule is currently enabled.
